title: The Bachelorette starring Angie Kent is beaten in the ratings by Gogglebox
text:
The Bachelorette starring Angie Kent was beaten in the overnight metro ratings by her old show, Gogglebox Australia.

On Thursday, only 631,000 people in the five capital cities tuned in to watch Angie take part in her first single and group dates.

Meanwhile, 704,000 metro viewers watched Gogglebox, which aired immediately afterwards on Channel 10 in the 8:40pm time slot.

Ratings miss! The Bachelorette starring Angie Kent (pictured) was beaten in the overnight metro ratings by her old show, Gogglebox Australia

The Bachelorette significantly outrated Channel Seven's Bride and Prejudice, which drew in 384,000 metro viewers.

Channel Nine's The Block was the most-watched entertainment program of the night, with an audience of 747,000 in the five capital cities.

Love Island Australia attracted just 240,000 metro viewers, but this figure does not represent the overall popularity of the show.

Oh, no! On Thursday, only 631,000 people in the five capital cities tuned in to watch Angie take part in her first single and group dates. Pictured: contestants Timm Hanly and Jackson Garlick

The popular bunch! Meanwhile, 704,000 metro viewers tuned into Gogglebox, which aired immediately afterwards on Channel 10 in the 8:40pm time slot. Pictured: Jad Nehmetallah with Sarah Marie and Matty Fahd

Love Island, which skews towards a much younger audience than other Nine shows, is known to attract significant ratings on streaming platform 9Now.

Angie's debut as the Bachelorette was a modest ratings hit, with 716,000 metro viewers watching the season premiere.

On Thursday's episode, Angie sent home contestant 'Dirty Jess' Glasgow for making inappropriate sexual remarks towards her and several female crew members.

Smaller numbers: The Bachelorette significantly outrated Channel Seven's Bride and Prejudice, which drew in 384,000 metro viewers. Pictured: Codie Lea and Nathan

Overall winner: Channel Nine's The Block was the most-watched entertainment program of the night, with an audience of 747,000 in the five capital cities. Pictured: Mitch and Mark

Trailing behind: Love Island Australia attracted just 240,000 metro viewers, but this figure does not represent the overall popularity of the show

The 37-year-old politician, who is facing calls to resign as a local councillor in Noosa, had been accused of making women on set 'feel uncomfortable'.

Before sending Jess home, Angie told him: 'You made me feel uncomfortable. You took it too far. You're going to have to leave.'

The Bachelorette continues Wednesday at 7:30pm on Channel 10
description: The Bachelorette starring Angie Kent was beaten in the overnight metro ratings by her old show, Gogglebox Australia.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
